Count of Unique & Duplicated Values of Each Column

Source: R/CountVal.R
CountVal.Rd

Counts the number of unique and duplicated column values

NA's are not included

TRUE values are counted for Factors

If Verbose = T, displays results to console

If Verbose = F, returns dataframe of counts

CountVal(x, verbose = TRUE)

Arguments

x

A matrix-like R object
verbose

Logical value to print results to console

Value

If Verbose = TRUE, nothing returned

If Verbose = FALSE, returns data frame of unique & dup values by column

See also

unique, duplicated

Examples

if (FALSE) {
#EXAMPLE
}
df_type <- data.frame(num1 = rnorm(5),
           int2= c(1:5),
           log3 = c(TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, FALSE, TRUE),
           fac4 = letters[1:5])
CountVal(df_type)
#> Column Value Occurances                       
#>   Column   Unique_Values   Duplicated_Values  
#> ──────────────────────────────────────────────
#>   num1                 5                   0  
#>   int2                 5                   0  
#>   log3                 2                   3  
#>   fac4                 5                   0  
value <- CountVal(df_type, verbose = FALSE)
